entry.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18676)
entry.content:
abolishicedenver - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=abolishicedenver&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pauder

entry.title: Via Mijente We know the Biden immigration bill will have...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Via Mijente

We know the Biden immigration bill will have language on border control tech & a "virtual wall."

Our report with American Friends Service Committee & Transnational Institute shows why we're concerned. The Democrats get big money from border firms. We can't allow a virtual wall instead of a physical one. Both will be deadly for immigrants. Read our latest research: tni.org/en/bidensborder

...

No te pierdas nuestro informe con Transnational Institute, TNI American Friends Service Committee –La frontera de Biden, en el que examinamos a 13 de las principales empresas de la industria de seguridad de fronteras y su poder e influencia en ambos partidos políticos de Estados Unidos:

https://t.co/yMIh5Bhi2h?amp=1

See MoreTransnational Institute, TNI

In 2020, Joe Biden received three times more donations than Donald Trump from the border security industry. Our new research with Mijente and American Friends S...ervice Committee looks into the deep ties of money and influence between the leading border security contractors and the Democratic Party - and shows why challenging this border-industrial complex will be critical if the US is to truly end racist hostility against migrants.

See More

entry.title: "After a period of clearing migrant children from their...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"After a period of clearing migrant children from their facility, Devereaux Behavioral Health in Westminster is quietly building up staffing for their ORR migrant children program. This is an organization that has been sued countless times for physical, emotional, and sexual abuse of children and which has been kicked out of several states because of their record of human rights abuses.

They are here in Colorado and need to be stopped."

Before the summer of 2018, most Americans had never heard of the Flores settlement or about the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) and its role in the care and placement of unaccompanied immigrant minors. Once it became known that the Trump administration was separating families at the border and....

boulderweekly.com

Federal judge orders ORR and ICE to release minors with ‘greater speed’ in light of the coronavirus - Boulder Weekly

entry.title: Freedom
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Freedom

Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.

nytimes.com

After Three Years in a Church Facing Deportation, ‘Today I Have Freedom’

Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.Saheeda Nadeem, 65, an undocumented immigrant from Pakistan who was given sanctuary by First Congregational Church in Kalamazoo, Mich., learned this week that she would not be deported, her lawyer said.

entry.title: "Based on multiple conversations with lawyers who work with...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Based on multiple conversations with lawyers who work with asylum seekers at the border and a review of hospital records and legal documents, multiple US citizen newborns were removed to Mexico after their mothers were subject to a Trump-era border ban that the Biden-Harris administration has been slow to rescind [...]

In fiscal year 2020, CBP reported over 200,000 expulsions – including unaccompanied children – were turned back under the Title 42. In the first three months of fiscal year 2021 alone, expulsions have exceeded 190,000, to date. The Trump administration hailed Title 42 as “tremendously effective."

At least 11 migrant women sent to Mexico border towns without birth certificates for newborns since last March

theguardian.com

Revealed: US citizen newborns sent to Mexico under Trump-era border ban

At least 11 migrant women sent to Mexico border towns without birth certificates for newborns since last MarchAt least 11 migrant women sent to Mexico border towns without birth certificates for newborns since last March
